passages.1:1: The elder, to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth--and not I alone, but also all those who know the truth--
passages.1:2: because of the truth that resides in us and will be with us {forever}<note: Or "in perpetuity"; literally "for the age">.
passages.1:3: Grace, mercy, peace will be with us from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Son of the Father in truth and love.
passages.1:4: {I was very glad}<note: Literally "I rejoiced exceedingly"> because I found [some] of your children walking in [the] truth, just as {the Father commanded us}<note: Literally "we received commandment from the Father">.
passages.1:5: And now I ask you, lady (not as [if I were] writing a new commandment to you, but [one] that we have had from the beginning), that we should love one another.
passages.1:6: And this is love: that we walk according to his commandments. This is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.
passages.1:7: For many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not confess Jesus Christ<note: Or "confess Jesus [as] Christ coming in [the] flesh" (see 1 John 4:2)> coming in [the] flesh. This person is the deceiver and the antichrist!
passages.1:8: Watch yourselves that you do not lose what we have worked for, but receive a full reward.
passages.1:9: Everyone who goes too far and does not remain in the teaching of Christ does not have God. The one who remains in the teaching--this person has both the Father and the Son.
passages.1:10: If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him into [your] house and do not speak a greeting to him,
passages.1:11: because the one who speaks a greeting to him shares in his evil deeds.
passages.1:12: [Although]<note: *Here "[although]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("have") which is understood as concessive> I have many [things] to write to you, I do not want [to do so] by means of paper and ink, but I hope to be with you and to speak {face to face}<note: Literally "mouth to mouth">, so that your<note: Some manuscripts have "our"> joy may be complete.
passages.1:13: The children of your elect sister greet you.
